title: Joanna Gaines says husband Chip wants more children: 'There's never too many'
text:
CLOSE

Chip Gaines and Joanna Gaines shared that they may not be done having kids yet. (Photo: Noam Galai, Getty Images for TIME)

Chip and Joanna Gaines and counting?

In a teaser clip for the "Fixer Upper" couple's interview with "Sunday Today's" Willie Geist, airing Sunday on NBC (8 a.m. ET), Chip expressed how his love and adoration for Joanna makes him want to have more kids with her.

"When you were just saying all those things, my heart just burst open," Chip said after his wife spoke about parenting lessons they learned. "Like, I could see Crew having a little sibling and me being like, ‘I love this woman!' "

Joanna jokingly urged Geistto change the subject, sharing how her husband loves having a full house and if it were up to him, they'd continue having kids well into their 50s.

"When I’m 50, Chip’s going to want more kids. Just know, this is going to be the headline forever, 'Jo’s pregnant again,' " Joanna said, adding that her husband with kids is like him with businesses. "There's never too many."

"He’s like, ‘I just think we can keep having them,’ " Joanna continued. "I think Chip just loves a full plate."

The couple are currently parents to five kids: Drake, 14, Ella Rose, 13, Duke, 11, Emmie Kay, 9, and baby Crew, 1.

Shortly after giving birth to Crew last year, Joanna acknowledged Chip wants a sister for their youngest, an option that still seems to be on thetable. "I love the process of being pregnant," she told "Today" anchors Savannah Guthrie and Hoda Kotb. "I love giving birth."

The Gaineses recently added another project to their pile. The couple is opening a boutique hotel in Waco, Texas, in 2021.

Joanna announced the project on her social media channels and in a post on the Magnolia blog. The Gaines' Magnolia brand includes shops and a restaurant in Waco; an online store that carries clothing, decor and more; and a realty company, among other ventures.

"This fall, we’ll begin renovations on a historic building in downtown Waco, just a few blocks from Magnolia Market at the Silos," she wrote in the post.
